title: Someone needs to tell news.com.au that this isn't how pie charts work. Why is contagiousness a percentage?
author: joshyv8

duplicated_posts.title: That... that’s not how a pie chart works. Can thank the Australian Murdoch press for this one.
duplicated_posts.author: simpliflyed

remarks:
4.12% is a thousand times smaller than 35.31%.
Encoding value with both angle and radius, making the area of a wedge exponentially small.
Figures are percentages, but described as number of people.
